classFeature.name: Alchemical Experiments
entries: You gain a set of Alchemist’s Supplies and proficiency with it.
You can use Alchemist’s Supplies to create a Potion of Healing over the course of a Long Rest if you have the necessary components.

entries.name: Ferocity
entries: Your speed isn’t reduced by difficult terrain.
When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, you can move up to half your speed as part of the same action.

entries.name: Monstrosity
entries: Your reach increases by 5 feet.
If you make a Strength-based melee attack and miss, add your Rage Damage bonus to the total for purposes of effects that trigger on a hit (the attack still misses).
If there is space, you count as Large for grapple and shove attempts.

entries.name: Reconstruction
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you can spend one Hit Die to regain hit points equal to the roll + your Constitution modifier (excess becomes temporary hit points which vanish when your Rage ends).
While this serum is active, you have vulnerability to acid and fire damage.

entries.name: Ferocity — Corrosive Expulsion
entries: As an Action (or as part of the Bonus Action to enter your Rage), expel corrosive fumes in a 15-foot cone or 30-foot line.
Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + Con mod + PB), taking acid damage equal to your Rage Damage × d8 on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
Once per Rage.

entries.name: Monstrosity — Blindside Stomp
entries: When you hit with a melee weapon attack, the target must make a Strength saving throw (DC as above) or be knocked prone.
Uses equal to PB per long rest.

entries.name: Reconstruction — Venting Carapace
entries: When a creature within 5 feet hits you with a melee attack, you can use your Reaction to deal acid damage equal to your Constitution modifier + your Rage Damage.
Uses equal to PB per long rest.

classFeature.name: Hardened Physiology
entries: You gain resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against being Poisoned.
When you finish a Short Rest, you can remove one of the following conditions affecting you: Blinded, Deafened, Poisoned, or one level of Exhaustion (once per short or long rest).

entries.name: Ferocity
entries: Your movement doesn’t provoke Opportunity Attacks.
When you move through a creature’s space, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC as above) or fall prone and take bludgeoning damage equal to your Rage Damage.

entries.name: Monstrosity
entries: Your reach increases by an additional 5 feet (total +10 feet).
When you hit a creature with a melee attack, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC as above) or be Grappled (escape DC same as save DC) until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Reconstruction
entries: You can spend up to two Hit Dice at the start of each of your turns and add your Barbarian level to the restored total; while this apex is active, you are immune to the Poisoned condition.

classFeature.name: Whistle Companions
entries: As a Bonus Action, summon spectral musical companions that occupy your space for 1 minute.

Choose one effect when summoned (you can choose a different one each time): advantage on Performance and Persuasion checks; impose disadvantage on one creature’s next attack against you as a Reaction; or enable you to give Bardic Inspiration as part of the same Bonus Action.
Uses equal to PB (regain on a long rest).

classFeature.name: Whistled Cantrips
entries: You learn the gust and minor illusion cantrips; they count as Bard spells for you.

classFeature.name: Piercing Trill
entries: As an Action, creatures in a 15-foot cone that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be Charmed by you until the end of your next turn.
Hostile creatures have disadvantage on the save if affected by your Whistle Companions this round.
Once per long rest; you can expend a 3rd-level or higher spell slot to use it again.

classFeature.name: Chorus of Echoes
entries: When you use Bardic Inspiration on an ally, another ally of your choice within 30 feet also gains a die of Bardic Inspiration (once per turn).
Your Whistle Companions no longer require concentration and persist their full duration while you concentrate on a Bard spell.

classFeature.name: Blessing of the Field
entries: As an Action, bless a 10‑foot‑radius area of ground for 1 hour; allies there gain a bonus to Wisdom (Survival) checks and saving throws against being Frightened equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum +1).
Uses equal to PB (regain on a long rest).

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity — Harvest
entries: As an Action, present your holy symbol to either nurture or scour:
- Heal creatures of your choice in a 30‑foot radius for 2d6 + your Cleric level, or
- Force creatures of your choice in a 30‑foot radius to make a Constitution save or take 2d6 + your Cleric level necrotic or radiant damage (your choice).

classFeature.name: Reaper’s Aegis
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet drops to 0 hit points, you can use your Reaction to grant another creature within 30 feet temporary hit points equal to your Cleric level + your Wisdom modifier.

classFeature.name: Blessed Harvest
entries: When you or an ally within 30 feet rolls a Hit Die, add your Wisdom modifier to the total restored.

classFeature.name: Sheaf of Plenty
entries: After a long rest, create a number of magical sheaves equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1).

As a Bonus Action, you or a creature within 30 feet can expend a sheaf to heal 1d4 + your Wisdom modifier hit points or to deal 1d4 + your Wisdom modifier radiant damage on the next weapon hit before the end of its next turn.
